intro: Jamaiciella triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves and small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in tidal zones. Jamaiciella triquetra is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periodic flooding, making it a hardy coastal species. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important plant in marine and coastal ecosystems.
